title: Forager Cycles Stocks New Stainless 8/10 Wrench and Four Pack of Cable Cherries
content:
Forager Cycles just announced yesterday the inclusion of an 8/10 mm stainless Link Wrench that is cheaper than the titanium version. This Stainless 8/10 mm Link Wrench only version provides more clearance at the 8mm end for accessing nuts with an obstruction behind them (e.g., a rack tube, raised edge, etc.). If some 8 mm nuts on your bicycle have a bracket or tube behind them, this version is not only cheaper but also solves any rack interference issues. The Washington-based component manufacturer is also now stocking its machined-in-house Cable Cherries in four packs ($36), including the complete anodizing color offering.

Check out more at Forager Cycles.

The post Forager Cycles Stocks New Stainless 8/10 Wrench and Four Pack of Cable Cherries appeared first on The Radavist.
author: John Watson
